intro: Kohautia quartiniana, commonly known as the Quartinian kohautia, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. Native to South America, particularly Brazil, it thrives in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately compound, and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species, making it a subject of interest for botanical conservation efforts.
